四一二.definition: 12th April; refers to Chiang Kai-shek's coup of 12th April 1927 against the communists in Shanghai

四一二事變.definition: the coup of 12th Mar 1927, an attempt by Chiang Kai-shek to suppress the communists; called 反革命政變|反革命政变 or 慘案|惨案 in PRC literature

四一二反革命政變.pinyin: si4 yi1 er4 fan3 ge2 ming4 zheng4 bian4
四一二反革命政變.definition: counterrevolutionary coup of 12th April 1927, Chiang Kai-shek's coup against the communists in Shanghai

四一二慘案.definition: the massacre of 12th Mar 1927; the Shanghai coup of 12th Mar 1927 by Chiang Kai-shek against the communists

四不像.definition: common name for 麋鹿[mi2 lu4], Père David's deer (Elaphurus davidianus), which is said to resemble an amalgam of animals such as a cow, deer, donkey and horse; an odd mixture of disparate elements; hodgepodge; farrago

四人幫.definition: Gang of Four: Jiang Qing 江青[Jiang1 Qing1], Zhang Chunqiao 張春橋|张春桥[Zhang1 Chun1 qiao2], Yao Wenyuan 姚文元[Yao2 Wen2 yuan2], Wang Hongwen 王洪文[Wang2 Hong2 wen2], who served as scapegoats for the excesses of the cultural revolution

四個全面.definition: Four Comprehensives (political guidelines announced by President Xi Jinping, 2015)

四個現代化.definition: Deng Xiaoping's four modernizations practiced from the 1980s (possibly planned together with Zhou Enlai), namely: modernization of industry, agriculture, national defense and science and technology; abbr. to 四化[si4 hua4]

四兩撥千斤.definition: lit. four ounces can move a thousand catties (idiom); fig. to achieve much with little effort

四出文錢.definition: coin minted in the reign of Emperor Ling of Han 漢靈帝|汉灵帝[Han4 Ling2 Di4], with a square hole in the middle and four lines radiating out from each corner of the square (hence the name 四出文)

四分五裂.definition: (idiom) fragmented; scattered; in disarray; at sixes and sevens

四分曆.definition: "quarter remainder" calendar, the first calculated Chinese calendar, in use from the Warring States period until the early years of the Han dynasty

四則運算.definition: the four basic operations of arithmetic (addition, subtraction, multiplication and division)

四化.definition: abbr. for 四個現代化|四个现代化[si4 ge4 xian4 dai4 hua4], Deng Xiaoping's four modernizations

四十二章經.definition: The Sutra in Forty-two Sections Spoken by the Buddha, the first Chinese Buddhist text, translated in 67 AD by Kasyapa-Matanga 迦葉摩騰|迦叶摩腾[Jia1 ye4 Mo2 teng2] and Gobharana 竺法蘭|竺法兰[Zhu2 fa3 lan2] (Dharmaraksha)

四合院.definition: courtyard house with a fully enclosed courtyard (type of Chinese residence)

四國.definition: Shikoku (one of the four main islands of Japan)

四圍.definition: all around; on all sides; encircled

四大.definition: the four elements: earth, water, fire, and wind (Buddhism); the four freedoms: speaking out freely, airing views fully, holding great debates, and writing big-character posters, 大鳴大放|大鸣大放[da4 ming2 da4 fang4], 大辯論|大辩论[da4 bian4 lun4], 大字報|大字报[da4 zi4 bao4] (PRC)

四大佛教名山.pinyin: Si4 da4 Fo2 jiao4 Ming2 shan1
四大佛教名山.definition: Four Sacred Mountains of Buddhism, namely: Mt Wutai 五臺山|五台山 in Shanxi, Mt Emei 峨眉山 in Sichuan, Mt Jiuhua 九華山|九华山 in Anhui, Mt Potala 普陀山 in Zhejiang

四大名著.definition: the Four Classic Novels of Chinese literature, namely: A Dream of Red Mansions 紅樓夢|红楼梦[Hong2 lou2 Meng4], Romance of Three Kingdoms 三國演義|三国演义[San1 guo2 Yan3 yi4], Water Margin 水滸傳|水浒传[Shui3 hu3 Zhuan4], Journey to the West 西遊記|西游记[Xi1 you2 Ji4]

四大天王.definition: the four heavenly kings (Sanskrit vajra); the four guardians or warrior attendants of Buddha

四大發明.definition: the four great Chinese inventions: paper, printing, magnetic compass and gunpowder

四大皆空.definition: lit. the four elements are vanity (idiom); this world is an illusion

四大盆地.definition: four great basin depressions of China, namely: Tarim 塔里木盆地 in south Xinjiang, Jungar 準葛爾盆地|准葛尔盆地 and Tsaidam or Qaidam 柴達木盆地|柴达木盆地 in north Xinjiang Sichuan 四川盆地

四大石窟.definition: the four great caves, namely: Longmen Grottoes 龍門石窟|龙门石窟[Long2 men2 Shi2 ku1] at Luoyang, Henan, Yungang Caves 雲岡石窟|云冈石窟[Yun2 gang1 Shi2 ku1] at Datong, Shanxi, Mogao Caves 莫高窟[Mo4 gao1 ku1] at Dunhuang, Gansu, and Mt Maiji Caves 麥積山石窟|麦积山石窟[Mai4 ji1 Shan1 Shi2 ku1] at Tianshui, Gansu

四大美女.definition: the four legendary beauties of ancient China, namely: Xishi 西施[Xi1 shi1], Wang Zhaojun 王昭君[Wang2 Zhao1 jun1], Diaochan 貂蟬|貂蝉[Diao1 Chan2] and Yang Yuhuan 楊玉環|杨玉环[Yang2 Yu4 huan2]

四大鬚生.definition: Four great beards of Beijing opera, namely: Ma Lianliang 馬連良|马连良, Tan Fuying 譚富英|谭富英, Yang Baosen 楊寶森|杨宝森, Xi Xiaobo 奚嘯伯|奚啸伯

四子王.definition: Siziwang banner or Dörvön-xüüxed khoshuu in Ulaanchab 烏蘭察布|乌兰察布[Wu1 lan2 cha2 bu4], Inner Mongolia

四子王旗.definition: Siziwang banner or Dörvön-xüüxed khoshuu in Ulaanchab 烏蘭察布|乌兰察布[Wu1 lan2 cha2 bu4], Inner Mongolia

四季.definition: four seasons, namely: spring 春[chun1], summer 夏[xia4], autumn 秋[qiu1] and winter 冬[dong1]

四季如春.definition: four seasons like spring; favorable climate throughout the year

四季豆.definition: green bean; French bean; runner bean

四害.definition: "the four pests", i.e. rats, flies, mosquitoes, and sparrows; see also 打麻雀運動|打麻雀运动[Da3 Ma2 que4 Yun4 dong4]

四小龍.definition: Four Asian Tigers; East Asian Tigers; Four Little Dragons (East Asian economic powers: Taiwan, South Korea, Singapore and Hong Kong)

四川外國語大學.pinyin: Si4 chuan1 Wai4 guo2 yu3 Da4 xue2

四川山鷓鴣.definition: (bird species of China) Sichuan partridge (Arborophila rufipectus)

四川旋木雀.definition: (bird species of China) Sichuan treecreeper (Certhia tianquanensis)

四川林鴞.definition: (bird species of China) Sichuan wood owl (Strix davidi)

四川柳鶯.definition: (bird species of China) Sichuan leaf warbler (Phylloscopus forresti)

四川省.definition: Sichuan Province, capital Chengdu 成都市[Cheng2du1 Shi4] (abbr. to 川[Chuan1] or 蜀[Shu3])

四川雉鶉.definition: (bird species of China) buff-throated monal-partridge (Tetraophasis szechenyii)

四平八穩.definition: everything steady and stable (idiom); overcautious and unimaginary

四平市.definition: Siping, prefecture-level city in Jilin Province 吉林省[Ji2lin2 Sheng3]

四庫.definition: the four book depositories, namely: classics 經|经, history 史, philosophy 子[zi3], belles-lettres 集

四庫全書.definition: Siku Quanshu (collection of books compiled during Qing dynasty)

四德.definition: four Confucian injunctions 孝悌忠信 (for men), namely: piety 孝 to one's parents, respect 悌 to one's older brother, loyalty 忠 to one's monarch, faith 信 to one's male friends; the four Confucian virtues for women of morality 德[de2], physical charm 容, propriety in speech 言 and efficiency in needlework 功

四捨五入.definition: (math.) to round up or down; to round off

四散.definition: to disperse; to scatter in all directions

四方.definition: four-way; four-sided; in all directions; everywhere

四方臺.definition: Sifangtai district of Shuangyashan city 雙鴨山|双鸭山[Shuang1 ya1 shan1], Heilongjiang

四方臺區.definition: Sifangtai district of Shuangyashan city 雙鴨山|双鸭山[Shuang1 ya1 shan1], Heilongjiang

四日市.definition: Yokkaichi, city in Mie Prefecture, Japan

四日市市.definition: Yokkaichi, city in Mie Prefecture, Japan

四旬齋.definition: Lent (Christian period of forty days before Easter)

四時.definition: the four seasons, namely: spring 春[chun1], summer 夏[xia4], autumn 秋[qiu1] and winter 冬[dong1]

四更.definition: fourth of the five night watch periods 01:00-03:00 (old)

四書.definition: Four Books, namely: the Great Learning 大學|大学, the Doctrine of the Mean 中庸, the Analects of Confucius 論語|论语, and Mencius 孟子

四會.definition: Sihui, county-level city in Zhaoqing 肇慶|肇庆[Zhao4 qing4], Guangdong

四會市.definition: Sihui, county-level city in Zhaoqing 肇慶|肇庆[Zhao4 qing4], Guangdong

四月.definition: April; fourth month (of the lunar year)

四民.definition: "the four classes" of ancient China, i.e. scholars, farmers, artisans, and merchants

四海之內皆兄弟.pinyin: si4 hai3 zhi1 nei4 jie1 xiong1 di4

四海昇平.definition: (idiom) the whole world is at peace

四海為家.definition: to regard the four corners of the world all as home (idiom); to feel at home anywhere; to roam about unconstrained; to consider the entire country, or world, to be one's own

四海飄零.definition: drifting aimlessly all over the place (idiom)

四清.definition: the Four Cleanups Movement (1963-66); abbr. for 四清運動|四清运动[Si4 qing1 Yun4 dong4]

四清運動.definition: the Four Cleanups Movement (1963-66), which aimed to cleanse the politics, economy, organization and ideology of the Communist Party

四湖.definition: Sihu (or Ssuhu) township in Yunlin county 雲林縣|云林县[Yun2 lin2 xian4], Taiwan

四湖鄉.definition: Sihu (or Ssuhu) township in Yunlin county 雲林縣|云林县[Yun2 lin2 xian4], Taiwan

四溢.definition: (of a perfume or a foul odor) permeating the whole place; (of grease etc) dripping everywhere; flowing all over the place

四濺.definition: (of droplets, sparks etc) to fly about in all directions; to splatter everywhere

四瀆.definition: (archaic) the four rivers (Yangtze 長江|长江[Chang2 Jiang1], Yellow 黃河|黄河[Huang2 He2], Huai 淮河[Huai2 He2], Ji 濟水|济水[Ji3 Shui3]); (TCM) acupuncture point SJ-9

四物湯.definition: four-substance decoction (si wu tang), tonic formula used in Chinese medicine

四目相對.definition: (of two people) to look into each other's eyes

四目相視.definition: see 四目相對|四目相对[si4mu4 xiang1dui4]

四目相覷.definition: see 四目相對|四目相对[si4mu4 xiang1dui4]

四眼田雞.definition: four-eyes (facetious term for a person who wears glasses)

四碳糖.definition: tetrose (CH2O)4, monosaccharide with four carbon atoms

四維.definition: the four social bonds: propriety, justice, integrity and honor; see 禮義廉恥|礼义廉耻[li3 yi4 lian2 chi3]; the four directions; the four limbs (Chinese medicine); four-dimensional

四聖諦.definition: the Four Noble Truths (Buddhism); see also 四諦|四谛[si4 di4] and 苦集滅道|苦集灭道[ku3 ji2 mie4 dao4]

四聲.definition: the four tones of Middle Chinese: level tone 平聲|平声, rising tone 上聲|上声, departing tone 去聲|去声 and entering tone 入聲|入声; the four tones of Modern Standard Mandarin

四聲杜鵑.definition: (bird species of China) Indian cuckoo (Cuculus micropterus)

四肢.definition: the four limbs of the body

四胡.definition: sihu (or "khuurchir" in Mongolian), a bowed instrument with four strings, primarily associated with Mongolian and Chinese culture

四腳朝天.definition: four legs facing the sky (idiom); flat on one's back

四舊.definition: the Four Olds (target of the Cultural Revolution)

四處.definition: all over the place; everywhere and all directions

四號電池.definition: AAA battery (Tw); PRC equivalent: 七號電池|七号电池[qi1 hao4 dian4 chi2]

四角.definition: the four corners (of a rectangle); the eaves that the four corners of a building

四角號碼.definition: four corner code (input method for Chinese characters)

四診.definition: (TCM) the four methods of diagnosis, namely 望診|望诊[wang4 zhen3] (observation), 聞診|闻诊[wen2 zhen3] (auscultation and olfaction), 問診|问诊[wen4 zhen3] (interrogation), 切診|切诊[qie4 zhen3] (pulse feeling and palpation)

四諦.definition: the Four Noble Truths (Budd.), covered by the acronym 苦集滅道|苦集灭道[ku3 ji2 mie4 dao4]: all life is suffering 苦[ku3], the cause of suffering is desire 集[ji2], emancipation comes only by eliminating passions 滅|灭[mie4], the way 道[dao4] to emancipation is the Eight-fold Noble Way 八正道[ba1 zheng4 dao4]

四象.definition: four divisions (of the twenty-eight constellations 二十八宿[er4 shi2 ba1 xiu4] of the sky into groups of seven mansions), namely: Azure Dragon 青龍|青龙[Qing1 long2], White Tiger 白虎[Bai2 hu3], Vermilion Bird 朱雀[Zhu1 que4], Black Tortoise 玄武[Xuan2 wu3]

四起.definition: to spring up everywhere; from all around

四通八達.definition: roads open in all directions (idiom); accessible from all sides

四靈.definition: four divinities; four divine emperors; four mythical creatures symbolic of prosperity and longevity, namely the phoenix 鳳|凤[feng4], turtle 龜|龟[gui1], dragon 龍|龙[long2] and Chinese unicorn 麒麟[qi2 lin2]; also 四象[si4 xiang4], the four division of the sky

四面楚歌.definition: lit. on all sides, the songs of Chu (idiom); fig. surrounded by enemies, isolated and without help

四項基本原則.pinyin: Si4 xiang4 Ji1 ben3 Yuan2 ze2
四項基本原則.definition: the Four Cardinal Principles enunciated by Deng Xiaoping 鄧小平|邓小平[Deng4 Xiao3 ping2] in 1979: to uphold the socialist road, the dictatorship of the proletariat, the leadership of the CCP, and Maoism and Marxism-Leninism

四體.definition: one's four limbs; two arms and two legs

四體不勤，五穀不分.pinyin: si4 ti3 bu4 qin2 , wu3 gu3 bu4 fen1
四體不勤，五穀不分.definition: never move your four limbs, can't distinguish the five crops (idiom); living as a parasite
